title: Crystal-Powered Train Station Adventure #24
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Main Platform
rooms.description: A grand Victorian-era train platform with vaulted glass ceilings. Crystalline chandeliers hang dark and lifeless overhead. The air is cold and still. Frost patterns cover the brass fixtures. Along the walls, dormant crystal sconces flicker weakly. A large information board displays frozen departure times.

items.name: abandoned ticket booth
items.description: A wooden booth with a brass cash register and dusty ledgers

items.name: brass station master key
items.description: An ornate brass key with a crystal embedded in its handle

items.name: departure information board
items.description: A large board with train schedules and station notices
items.text: NOTICE: Crystal Power System requires three types of crystals - Red (power level 7), Blue (power level 3), and Green (power level 9). Station Master is Chief Engineer Thornwick. Emergency protocols stored in Power Room vault.

items.name: old luggage cart
items.description: A wheeled cart with several compartments for storing baggage

items.name: engineer's journal
items.description: A leather-bound journal with technical notes
items.text: Day 47: The crystal power system is failing. I've hidden the red crystal in the luggage cart. The combination is the power levels in order: Red, Blue, Green. Remember - the station was founded in 1887. The crystals must be placed in the Crystal Resonance Chamber.

items.name: red power crystal
items.description: A glowing red crystal that pulses with warm energy

items.name: station storage locker
items.description: A tall metal locker with a crystal-shaped lock

items.name: blue power crystal
items.description: A cool blue crystal that hums with electrical energy

items.name: maintenance log
items.text: MAINTENANCE LOG: Chief Engineer Thornwick reporting. The green crystal is stored in the Crystal Power Room for safety. The resonance chamber is located in the Crystal Power Room. All crystals must be installed to activate the departure train.

items.name: crystal power room door
items.description: A heavy door with crystalline inlays leading to the power systems

rooms.name: Crystal Power Room
rooms.description: A circular chamber with walls lined with intricate copper pipes and crystal conduits. In the center stands a large brass mechanism with three crystal sockets - red, blue, and green. Gears and pistons wait silently for activation. A vault door on the east wall leads to the departure platform.

items.name: crystal resonance chamber
items.description: The main power mechanism with three empty crystal sockets
items.text: CRYSTAL RESONANCE CHAMBER: Insert Red, Blue, and Green crystals to restore station power. Warning: Improper installation may cause system failure.

items.name: brass control panel
items.description: A panel covered in gauges, switches, and indicator lights

items.name: green power crystal
items.description: A vibrant green crystal that radiates life energy

items.name: station technical manual
items.description: A thick manual with detailed diagrams and procedures
items.text: STATION OPERATIONS MANUAL: This station was founded in 1887 by Chief Engineer Thornwick. The Crystal Resonance Chamber powers all station systems. Emergency question protocols: What year was the station founded? Who is the chief engineer? Where are the crystals installed?

items.name: engineer's workbench
items.description: A cluttered workbench with tools and crystal fragments

items.name: emergency protocol note
items.description: A hastily written note about emergency procedures
items.text: EMERGENCY: If power fails, manually answer security questions at vault door. Answers are in the station records. The crystals go in the resonance chamber!

items.name: security vault door
items.description: A reinforced door with a security panel displaying three questions. Crystal energy flows through its locking mechanism.

password_questions.question: What year was this station founded?
password_questions.hint: Check the information board and technical manual

password_questions.question: Who is the chief engineer?
password_questions.hint: Look at the maintenance log and station notices

password_questions.question: Where are the power crystals installed?
password_questions.hint: Read the engineer's journal and technical manual

rooms.name: Departure Platform
rooms.description: You've made it! A magnificent steam train with crystal-powered engines sits on the tracks, its boiler glowing with restored energy. The crystalline chandeliers throughout the station blaze to life. Steam hisses from the locomotive as it prepares for departure. The conductor's ghost appears briefly, tipping his hat in gratitude before fading away.

items.name: crystal-powered locomotive
items.description: A beautiful steam engine with glowing crystal power cores, ready to carry you to safety

items.name: illuminated departure sign
items.description: A glowing sign reading 'ALL ABOARD - DESTINATION: FREEDOM'
items.text: The train is ready for departure. Your journey through the Crystal-Powered Train Station is complete!

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You've restored power to the Crystal-Powered Train Station and activated the departure train! The three crystals glow brilliantly in the resonance chamber as the station comes alive with light and energy. You board the magnificent locomotive and it pulls away from the platform, carrying you safely away from the frozen station. The adventure is complete! You win!
